greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sum of positive cranks minus the sum of positive ranks of all partitions of n.
comment: It appears this is also the column 0 of triangle A195011 without the first one (see the Andrews-Garvan-Liang paper, page 16).
Is this also the ospt(n) function mentioned in the Andrews-Chan-Kim paper? Is A115995(n) the first crank momment? Is A209616(n) the first rank moment? - Omar E. Pol, Apr 07 2012
link: G. E. Andrews, S. H. G. Chan, and B. Kim, The odd moments of ranks and cranks (This is the function C_1 - R_1 of that paper), Journal of Combinatorial Theory, Series A, Volume 120, Issue 1, January 2013, Pages 77-91.
G. E. Andrews, F. G. Garvan, and J. Liang, Combinatorial interpretation of congruences for the spt-function, The Ramanujan Journal, December 2012, Volume 29, Issue 1-3, pp 321-338.
A. O. L. Atkins and F. G. Garvan, Relations between the ranks and cranks of partitions, arXiv:math/0208050 [math.NT], 2002.
Frank Garvan, Dyson's rank function and Andrews's SPT-function [Broken link?]
example: The sum of positive cranks is 6+3+4+2+1 = 16 and the sum of positive ranks is 5+1+2+3+1 = 12 therefore a(6) = 16 - 12 = 4.
mathematica: CoefficientList[Series[C1-R1, {q, 0, M}], q] // Rest (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Aug 18 2018, translated from Maple *)
results.author: _Omar E. Pol_, Jan 10 2012
